sen.j: 宇治市植物公園（うじししょくぶつこうえん）は、京都府宇治市にある植物園。
sen.e: Uji City Botanical Gardens are located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Uji City Botanical Gardens are located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Uji City Botanical Gardens are located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 面積10ヘクタールの敷地に約1450種類、約3200本の植物が植えられている。
sen.e: In a total area of ten hectares, thirty two hundred plants of fourteen hundred and fifty species are grown.
In a total area of ten hectares, thirty two hundred plants of fourteen hundred and fifty species are grown.
In a total area of ten hectares, thirty two hundred plants of fourteen hundred and fifty species are grown.

sen.j: 山野草展、木の実展、春蘭展など、植物に関するさまざまな展示会を年間25回展示開催している。
sen.e: Various exhibitions focused on plants are held at twenty five times a year including Sanyaso (plants growing wilds in field and mountains,) nuts, riverstream orchids, etc.
Various exhibitions focused on plants are held at twenty five times a year including Sanyaso (plants growing wild in fields and mountains,) nuts, river orchids, etc.
Various exhibitions focused on plants are held at twenty five times a year including Sanyaso (plants growing wild in fields and mountains,) nuts, river orchids, etc.

sen.j: 洪水調整池を利用し、カキツバタ、キショウブ、ミソハギ等を植栽して夏季には彩り豊かな水辺景観が見られる。
sen.e: Using the flood control reservoirs, rabbitear irises, iris pseudacoruss, purple loosestrifes, etc. are grown there, providing a rich and colorful waterscape in summer.
Using flood control reservoirs, rabbitear irises, iris pseudacoruss, purple loosestrifes, etc. are grown there, providing a rich and colorful waterscape in summer.
Using flood control reservoirs, rabbitear irises, iris pseudacoruss, purple loosestrifes, etc. are grown there, providing a rich and colorful waterscape in summer.

sen.j: 園沿いに四季おりおりに咲き誇る草花を配置し、早春から夏にはウメ、サトザクラ、バラ、サルスベリなどの花が見られ、花爛漫の景が見られる。
sen.e: Seasonally blooming flowers are grown in the Gardens, and plums, prunus iannesianas, roses, crape myrtles, etc. will bloom over the period from early spring to summer, providing sceneries in all glory.
Seasonally blooming flowers are grown in the Gardens, and plums, prunus iannesianas, roses, crape myrtles, etc. will bloom over the period from early spring to summer, providing glorious scenery.
Seasonally blooming flowers are grown in the Gardens, and plums, prunus iannesianas, roses, crape myrtles, etc. will bloom over the period from early spring to summer, providing glorious scenery.

sen.j: 日本古来の棚田の景観を昇華させ、ヒガンバナ、スイセン等で彩り、壇上の花園が見られる。
sen.e: Japanese traditional terraced rice fields were reproduced to grow lycoris, daffodils, etc., providing an opportunity, giving an opportunity to enjoy the flower gardens at a high elevation.
Japanese traditional terraced rice fields were reproduced to grow lycoris, daffodils, etc., providing an opportunity to enjoy the flower gardens at a high elevation.
Japanese traditional terraced rice fields were reproduced to grow cluster amaryllis, daffodils, etc., providing an opportunity to enjoy the flower gardens at a high elevation.

tit.j: 壁泉・カナール・花の広場
tit.e: Hekisen (water outlet constructed on a wall,) Canal, Hana no hiroba (Flower Plaza)
Hekisen (water outlet constructed on a wall,) Canal, Hana no hiroba (Flower Plaza)
Hekisen (water outlet constructed on a wall), Canal, Hana no hiroba (Flower Plaza)
tit.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 壁泉から花と水のタペストリーに至る水の流れ（カナール）の両サイドに針葉樹林と花壇が展開し、花の広場に至る。
sen.e: The coniferous forest and flowerbeds stretch on the both sides of the stream (Canal) from Hekisen to Flower and Water Tapestry, following which Hana no hiroba (Flower Plaza) is exhibited.
The coniferous forest and flowerbeds stretch on the both sides of the stream (Canal) from Hekisen to Flower and Water Tapestry, following which Hana no hiroba (Flower Plaza) is exhibited.
The coniferous forest and flowerbeds stretch on the both sides of the stream (Canal) from Hekisen to Flower and Water Tapestry, following which Hana no hiroba (Flower Plaza) is exhibited.

sen.j: 花の広場では、池・滝・タペストリーを一体化させ、池上にはステージを設け、コンサートなどのイベントも開催される。
sen.e: The pond, cascade and tapestries are unified at Hana no hiroba, and there is a floating stage in the pond to hold concerts, events and so on.
The pond, cascade and tapestries come together at Hana no hiroba, and there is a floating stage in the pond to hold concerts, events and so on.
The pond, cascade and tapestries come together at Hana no hiroba, and there is a floating stage in the pond to hold concerts, events and so on.

tit.j: 花と水のタペストリー

sen.j: 本公園を代表する施設で、宇治市に因んだテーマやキャラクターなどの絵柄を草花で描く。
sen.e: They are the representative facilities in the Gardens, and themes or characters related to Uji City are formed using plants and flowers.
They are the face of the Gardens, and themes or characters related to Uji City are formed using plants and flowers.
They are the face of the Gardens, and themes or characters related to Uji City are formed using plants and flowers.

sen.j: 幅62m、高さ18mの雛壇（46段）に、3675基のプランターを並べ、季節に合った植物で演出がなされている。
sen.e: It is composed of thirty six hundred and seventy five pots placed on the terraced garden (forty six tiers) of sixty two cent meters in width and eighteen cent meters in height and is featured by seasonally blooming flowers.

It is composed of thirty six hundred and seventy five pots placed on the terraced garden (forty six tiers) of sixty two cent meters in width and eighteen cent meters in height and features seasonally blooming flowers.
It is composed of 3,675 pots placed on the terraced garden (46 tiers) of 62 meters in width and 18 meters in height and features seasonally blooming flowers.

sen.j: 薬、料理の味付け、保存、防虫、芳香等に使われ、暮らしの中に取り入れられてきたハーブを140種収集展示してある。
sen.e: A hundred and forty kinds of herbs useful for medicines, seasonings, restoration, insect deterrents, aromatic odors, etc. and used in our daily lives are displayed.
A hundred and forty kinds of herbs useful for medicines, seasonings, restoration, insect deterrents, aromatic odors, etc. and used in our daily lives are displayed.
The 140 kinds of herbs useful for medicines, seasonings, restoration, insect deterrents, aromatic odors, etc. and used in our daily lives are displayed.

sen.j: 宇治で選抜された茶の3原木を展示している。
sen.e: Three virgin tea trees selected and determined in Uji are on display.
Three virgin tea trees selected and determined in Uji are on display.
Three virgin tea trees selected and determined in Uji are on display.

sen.j: カマツガ、ウメモドキ等の低木や、クマザサ等の地被植物を加え、趣のあるアカマツ林を創出している。
sen.e: Short-height trees such as カマツガ and ilexes and ground cover plants such as low bamboos are also grown there, featuring the red pine forest with atmosphere.
sen.cmt: カマツガは調べましたが英語名が分かりませんでした。
sen.e: Short-height trees such as カマツガ and ilexes and ground cover plants such as low bamboos are also grown there, featuring the red pine forest with atmosphere.
Short-height trees such as Pourthiaea villosa and ilexes and ground cover plants such as low bamboos are also grown there, featuring the red pine forest with atmosphere.
sen.cmt: カマツガ（カマツカ）→Pourthiaea villosa

sen.j: 園沿いには、日本各地の野生菊を収集展示している。
sen.e: Wild chrysanthemums collected from various places in Japan are displayed near the red pine forest.
Wild chrysanthemums collected from various places in Japan are displayed near the red pine forest.
Wild chrysanthemums collected from various places in Japan are displayed near the red pine forest.

sen.j: コナラ、クヌギ等による雑木林の景観を基調として、ユスラウメ、ツリバナ、キキョウ等を加え、野趣に富む景観を創出している。
sen.e: In addition to the basic scenery of the thicket composed of Quercus serratas, oaks, etc., Nanking cherries (prunus tomentosa,) euonymus oxyphyllus, balloonflowers (bellflowers,) etc. are also grown, providing a scenery full of rustic atmosphere.

In addition to the basic scenery of the thicket composed of Quercus serratas, oaks, etc., Nanking cherries (prunus tomentosa,) euonymus oxyphyllus, balloonflowers (bellflowers,) etc. are also grown, providing a scenery full of rustic atmosphere.

In addition to the basic scenery of the thicket composed of Quercus serratas, oaks, etc., Nanking cherries (prunus tomentosa,) euonymus oxyphyllus, balloonflowers (bellflowers,) etc. are also grown, providing a scenery full of rustic atmosphere.

sen.j: モミジ類の他、マユミ、ムラサキシキブ、マンリョウ等により、「秋の錦の景」を創出している。
sen.e: In addition to various kinds of maple trees, euonymus sieboldianuses, callicarpa japonicas, ardisia crenatas, etc. are grown in the forest, creating 'a scenery of the splendor of colored autumn.'
In addition to various kinds of maple trees, euonymus sieboldianuses, callicarpa japonicas, ardisia crenatas, etc. are grown in the forest, creating a scene of the splendor and colore of autumn.
In addition to various kinds of maple trees, euonymus sieboldianuses, callicarpa japonicas, ardisia crenatas, etc. are grown in the forest, creating a scene of the splendor and colore of autumn.

sen.j: 池端に茶亭を設け、茶花を配し落ちついた日本的な風情を演出している。
sen.e: There is Chatei (a rest house) by the pond, decorated with Chabana (flowers appropriate for tea ceremonies or tea house,) and it features calm and Japanese-style feeling.
There is a Chatei (rest house) by the pond, decorated with Chabana (flowers appropriate for tea ceremonies or tea house,) and it features a calm and Japanese-style feeling.
There is a Chatei (rest house) by the pond, decorated with Chabana (flowers appropriate for tea ceremonies or tea house), and it features a calm and Japanese-style feeling.
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。

tit.e: Plants related to the Tale of Genji
Plants related to the Tale of Genji
Plants related to the Tale of Genji

sen.j: 宇治十帖に因み、源氏物語にみられる植物を円沿いに植栽し、歌碑等も添えて情景がイメージできる空間を創出している。
sen.e: Based on Uji Jujo (last ten chapters of the Tale of Genji,) the plants appearing in the Tale of Genji are grown and monuments engraved waka poem are installed in the Gardens to create the atmosphere where the visitors can get the images of the scenes in the story.

Based on Uji Jujo (last ten chapters of the Tale of Genji,) the plants appearing in the Tale of Genji are grown and monuments engraved with waka poems are installed in the Gardens to create an atmosphere in which visitors can imagine scenes in the story.

Based on Uji Jujo (last ten chapters of the Tale of Genji,) the plants appearing in the Tale of Genji are grown and monuments engraved with waka poems are installed in the Gardens to create an atmosphere in which visitors can imagine scenes in the story.

sen.j: 宇治駅 (JR西日本)、京阪宇治駅 (京阪)、近畿日本鉄道大久保駅 (京都府)からバスで約10分、植物公園下車。
sen.e: Take a bus at Uji Station (JR West,) Keihan Uji Station (Keihan,) or Kinki Nippon Railway Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and get off at Shokubutu Koen (the botanical park) stop after an approximately ten minute ride.

Take a bus at Uji Station (JR West), Keihan Uji Station (Keihan), or Kinki Nippon Railway Okubo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and get off at Shokubutu Koen (the botanical park) stop after an approximately ten minute ride.
